business.headline: Is it possible to improve your credit score without owning a card?Many people assume that a credit card is essential for building a good credit score. But experts say that's not true. With the right financial habits and timely repayments, you can strengthen your credit profile even without owning a card.

India-US trade deal nearing first-phase closure as tariff talks progress: ReportIndia and the US are negotiating a bilateral trade agreement. So far, six rounds of talks have been completed. Both sides have announced plans to finalise the first tranche of the deal by fall of 2025.

The hidden risk in 'diversified' portfolios: Expert explainsThe idea that "more products mean more safety" is common among investors, but it can be misleading. An expert's recent client case shows why portfolios that look balanced may still be exposed to the same underlying risk.

Ever heard of Birkin Bag Hedge Fund? Check the details hereBy focusing on colours and styles that sell the fastest, the fund aims to keep its turnover high and returns steady. Its strategy also reflects how the luxury resale market has matured into a serious business, where handbags are now viewed as long-term investment assets.
Sensex ends 388 points higher, Nifty above 26,000; Eternal gains 2%The S&P BSE Sensex gained 388.17 points to close at 84,950.95, while the NSE Nifty50 added 103.40 points to end at 26,013.45.

Who is Groww founder Lalit Keshre, who just turned billionaire after IPO?Groww, which started in 2016 as a simple idea to make investing easy for young Indians, is now one of the country's most valuable fintech firms.

Anil Ambani offers to give virtual statement in money laundering caseReliance Group chairman Anil Ambani has offered to give his statement through video conference to the Enforcement Directorate, following his absence twice in a FEMA probe related to a 2010 highway project.

US dumps the penny, but some of them can still earn you $5 millionThe US Mint officially ended production of the one-cent coin on November 12. US Treasurer Brandon Beach struck the last penny at the Philadelphia Mint, marking the end of the 232-year-old coin that first entered circulation in 1793.

Is India becoming the world's next big consumption powerhouse?While many economies struggle with sluggish demand, India is quietly powering ahead. A booming middle class, strong domestic spending, and favourable demographics are transforming the country into a consumption force that global brands can no longer ignore.

Why has Bitcoin fallen to $93,000 after touching $126,000 in October?The cryptocurrency has now lost more than 10% in the past week, marking its third straight weekly decline. Bitcoin, along with Ethereum, XRP, Cardano, Solana and other major altcoins witnessed a decline in their prices.

Is your Digital Life Certificate rejected? Here's how you can fix itMany pensioners use the Digital Life Certificate to complete their yearly verification from home, but rejections are still common. If your certificate has been turned down, here's a simple look at why it happens and how you can sort it out.
Explained: Why Tata Motors PV shares crashed 6% todayJLR suffered a major setback in Q2, prompting the company to slash its full-year EBIT margin guidance to 0–2% from the earlier 5–7%.

Which cities are seeing a rise in office spaces, and whyIndia's economic story — steady growth, stable demand, and improving infrastructure — is not only creating demand for office spaces but also enabling developers to capitalise on real estate opportunities.

India to source 10% of annual LPG imports from US under first-ever dealThe contract is India's first-ever structured LPG purchase agreement with the US, and is benchmarked to Mont Belvieu, the key US pricing hub for LPG.

Fujiyama Power Systems IPO Day 3: Check latest GMP, subscription status and moreThe IPO, priced between Rs 216 and Rs 228 per share, aims to raise Rs 828 crore. This includes a fresh issue of Rs 600 crore and an offer for sale worth Rs 228 crore by promoters Yogesh Dua and Pawan Kumar Garg.

Capillary Technologies IPO Day 2: Check latest GMP and should you apply?Capillary Technologies' IPO has opened to a cautious start with weak early subscription and a cooling GMP, but long-term brokerage views remain positive, making investors weigh short-term sentiment against long-term potential.

Why buying health insurance should be your first move in personal financeHealth insurance is often treated as an afterthought, yet a single medical emergency can undo years of savings. With rising healthcare costs, early coverage has become the most essential starting point in personal finance.

Sensex, Nifty open in green as earnings optimism lifts sentimentAt around 9:18 am, the S&P BSE Sensex was up 87.27 points at 84,650.05, while the NSE Nifty50 rose 24.50 points to 25,934.55. Broader market indices were mixed in early trade.

Tenneco Clean Air IPO allotment today: Check status, GMP, and listing detailsInvestors can check their allotment status using either the BSE website or the MUFG Intime India portal. The IPO saw heavy bidding across categories. Overall, it was subscribed 61.79 times.

Trump invests at least $82m in bonds, including sectors boosted by his own policiesDonald Trump purchased over $82 million in corporate and municipal bonds from late August to early October. These investments include sectors benefiting from his administration's policies, raising questions about potential conflicts of interest.

entertainment.headline: Bigg Boss 19 Episode 86: Ashnoor breaks down after father's question on weight The 'Bigg Boss 19' episode on November 17 saw tensions among housemates give way to emotional family reunions as the Top 9 contestants experienced the start of family week.

Priyanka Chopra takes fans behind the scenes of Mahesh Babu's Varanasi event Priyanka Chopra shared exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpses of the grand 'Varanasi' event at Hyderabad. The celebration featured a dramatic title reveal of SSMB29, with performances and heartfelt moments that captivated the audience.

Man who attacked Ariana Grande at Wicked Singapore premiere gets 9 days in jail The intruder who attempted to grab Ariana Grande at the Singapore premiere of 'Wicked: For Good' has been sentenced to nine days in prison. The film will release on November 21.

Delhi Crime 3 team on 8-hour shifts: Actors unfairly blamed for delays 'Delhi Crime 3' cast and crew spoke about the difficulty of sticking to an 8-hour workday in the industry. They stressed the need for a fair balance while noting that makeup and prep time are essential parts of filming, not extra hours.

Kushboo hits back at trolls after Sundar C exits Rajinikanth's Thalaivar173 Sundar C stepped down from the highly anticipated Rajinikanth and Kamal Haasan film, sparking social media debate and speculations, leading to social media trolling and strong responses from Kushboo Sundar.

Vikram Bhatt denies Rs 30 crore fraud allegation, vows to show evidence Filmmaker Vikram Bhatt has denied Rs 30 crore fraud allegations made by Dr Ajay Murdia, the founder of Indira IVF, after an FIR was filed against him and seven others in Udaipur. Bhatt claims the accusations are misleading and insists he is ready to present evidence to the authorities.

Last Samurai Standing review: Netflix's samurai saga is more brutal than Squid GameRelease Date:Thu Nov 13, 2025 Netflix's 'Last Samurai Standing' brings together gripping samurai action and Meiji-era politics, showing the struggles of a warrior class losing its place in society. With a strong mix of history and survival drama, it's a solid watch for anyone who enjoys intense and meaningful storytelling.

Sydney Sweeney in James Bond film? Read which role she'd have fun playing Hollywood star Sydney Sweeney opens up on rumours linking her to the next James Bond film, and guess which role she wants to play?

Timothee Chalamet fanboys over Adam Sandler, says he deserves an Oscar Timothee Chalamet and Adam Sandler came together for a special event in Los Angeles, where the latter was all praise for the 'Happy Gilmore' actor.

Singer Akhil Sachdeva on birth of his daughter: My mother is finally back Singer-composer Akhil Sachdeva and his wife Tanya Gulla welcomed their first child, a baby girl, earlier this month. The couple shared the news on social media on Monday.

Pawan Kalyan calls iBomma founder's arrest a welcome move, praises Hyderabad Police Andhra Pradesh Deputy CM Pawan Kalyan joined senior Tollywood stars in praising the Hyderabad Police for arresting iBomma founder Immadhi Ravi, calling it a key breakthrough in the fight against movie piracy.

After The Girlfriend, Dheekshith Shetty leads heist film Bank of Bhagyalakshmi Dheekshith Shetty returns to Kannada cinema with the comedy heist film 'Bank of Bhagyalakshmi'. The trailer promises a unique blend of humour and thrills, releasing in theatres on November 21.

Aishwarya Sharma denies allegations of misconduct: People use my name for views Amid divorce rumours with Neil Bhatt, Aishwarya Sharma has responded to online speculation and negative commentary about her personal life. She addressed false narratives and emphasised her professionalism in an Instagram story.

Court rejects petition seeking name change of Farhan Akhtar's 120 Bahadur The Punjab and Haryana High Court refused to entertain a plea seeking to change the title of Farhan Akhtar's upcoming film 120 Bahadur. The court questioned the petitioners' sensitivity over the name while the film has received official clearance.

Fatima speaks hard truths on battling epilepsy, bulimia and years she lost to them Fatima Sana Shaikh opened up about her ongoing struggles with epilepsy and an eating disorder. She said these challenges began after her physical transformation for her debut film 'Dangal'.

Sai Pallavi posts heartfelt photos a month after Kalaimamani honour Sai Pallavi shared her experience of being honoured with the Kalaimamani award. The award was presented to her by Chief Minister of Tamil Nadu MK Stalin. She expressed her gratitude publicly and marked the occasion with her grandparents.

After Sinners, Ryan Coogler confirms his next film is Black Panther 3 Ryan Coogler has officially confirmed that 'Black Panther 3' is in the works. The filmmaker revealed that the movie will be his next project and hinted that Hollywood icon Denzel Washington may join the cast.

Bigg Boss 19: Abhishek, Mridul, Awez recreate memes; Nagma jokes about secret room Former 'Bigg Boss 19' contestants Abhishek Bajaj, Mridul Tiwari, Awez Darbar, and Nagma Mirajkar recently reunited for a fun reel. They recreated viral lines from their stint on the show and addressed the show's 'secret room' twist.

Bison on OTT: When and where to watch Dhruv Vikram's sports drama After a successful theatrical run, Mari Selvaraj's sports drama 'Bison Kaalamadan' prepares to reach a wider audience with its upcoming Netflix release, available in Tamil, Telugu, Malayalam, Kannada, and Hindi.

general news.headline: Delhi blast co-conspirator arrested, was told to be prepared for suicide attackAccording to sources, Danish was not only involved in the bombing conspiracy along with Umar, but was also told by him to be prepared to carry out a fidayeen (suicide) attack.

Hyderabad family loses 18 members from 3 generations in Saudi bus tragedyA tragic accident near Madina has claimed the lives of 18 members of a Hyderabad family returning from Umrah, leaving the city in deep mourning. The incident has sparked demands for accountability and support for the bereaved families.

What India said after Bangladesh demanded Hasina's extradition over convictionUnder the existing extradition treaty signed between the two countries in 2013, a request to extradite a leader in exile may be turned down if it is deemed "politically motivated" - a phrase Hasina has repeatedly used since she fled the country last year.

Iran ends visa-free entry for Indians; government warns about job fraud, kidnappingsThe latest decision marks a major shift in the country's travel policy, which earlier allowed Indians to travel to the country without obtaining a visa, in an attempt to strengthen diplomatic ties.

Hasina given death penalty on marriage anniversary. Conspiracy or coincidence?Social media users in Bangladesh are abuzz with speculation after the International Crimes Tribunal rescheduled its verdict from November 14 to November 17. The latter is Sheikh Hasina's wedding anniversary. Hasina was married to nuclear scientist MA Wazed Miah on this day in 1967. The change of date on social media has fuelled claims that the date for the verdict was deliberately chosen to add a symbolic sting to the ousted PM's death sentence.

Jaishankar meets Lavrov in Moscow as India, Russia prepare for December summitExternal Affairs Minister S Jaishankar is in Moscow for the Shanghai Cooperation Organisation heads of government meeting and held a detailed exchange with Lavrov on regional and global issues.

No work, no pay: Tamil Nadu warns staff planning strike over SIR workloadThe Tamil Nadu government has issued a strict warning to revenue department staff over their boycott of Special Intensive Revision duties, threatening salary deductions for non-compliance. This move highlights the growing tension between government authorities and employees amid an intense workload ahead of elections.

China warns Japan of economic blow, crushing defeat as Taiwan row escalatesChina has asked its visitors to avoid Japan after PM Sanae Takaichi's remarks over Taiwan plunged bilateral ties to the lowest in years. Other than economic retaliation, China has threatened Japan with a "crushing defeat" if it tried to intervene in its reunification bid with Taiwan.

Air purifiers too costly? Influencers share DIY videos to help build cheaper onesLike with air conditioners (ACs) in summer, the price of air purifiers shoots through the roof in winters in Delhi-NCR when the national capital becomes a gas chamber. Influencers have stepped in, sharing hacks and DIY videos to help build air purifiers at one-fourth the cost of branded ones. They also conduct tests and show how their cheaper air purifiers are bringing down AQI in controlled settings.

Ex-Bangladesh minister sentenced to death links verdict to Pak-backed groupsFormer Home Minister Asaduzzaman Khan Kamal has condemned the death sentence by Bangladesh's International Crimes Tribunal, calling it a politically motivated verdict against Awami League leadership. Speaking from India, he questioned the tribunal's legitimacy and warned of public backlash in Bangladesh.

Who is Danish, Delhi blast co-conspirator brainwashed by Umar for suicide attack?Danish was an active co-conspirator behind the attack and had worked closely with the terrorist, Umar un Nabi, to plan the terror carnage.

Sheikh Hasina gets death penalty, but she is in India: What happens now?Bangladesh has sentenced Sheikh Hasina to death, but she remains in India, beyond the tribunal's reach, prompting Dhaka to demand her extradition. For now, Hasina's fate rests entirely with New Delhi's next move.
Most pharma-grade protein powders in India found low-quality, high in sugarFirst Indian analysis reveals major quality gaps in medical nutrition powders

CGC University, Mohali: Where vision becomes legacy and education becomes evolutionStories of students who dare to dream, of educators who ignite curiosity, and of a community that chooses progress with purpose.

Maithili Thakur's 6-year-old Tamil song goes viral, state politicians cheerMaithili Thakur shared a video singing a Tamil song, prompting praise for her diction and cross-cultural ease. BJP leader Annamalai also praised her.

Explosives seized from terrorists transferred from Faridabad to J&K: What SOP saysIndia Today breaks down the standard protocol followed by state police, Special Cell, NIA, NSG, and district bomb squads when they encounter a sizeable stock of Ammonium Nitrate, ANFO, or the far more unstable TATP, the explosive often dubbed "Mother of Satan".

Little boy dances to Hrithik Roshan's Janaab-e-Aali as classmates cheer in viral videoA video of a little boy dancing to Hrithik Roshan's popular track 'Janaab-e-Aali' from War 2 has delighted the internet.

Decline in Indian students fuels 17% drop in new US international enrolment: ReportAmong the institutions reporting declines, 96 per cent pointed to concerns about the visa application process. Another 68 per cent cited travel restrictions, according to the nonprofit Institute of International Education, which gathered data from 825 US higher education institutions.

Fake Nandini ghee racket busted in Bengaluru; dip in orders exposed accusedKarnataka Milk Federation officials busted a fake ghee racket run by an authorised distributor in Bengaluru. The distributor allegedly diluted genuine Nandini ghee with palm oil and sold it to parlours.

Cognizant to monitor employees, laptops will be termed idle post 5 mins breakCognizant is reportedly cracking down on its employees with stricter monitoring systems. Now, employees may be marked 'idle' in case of no activity on their laptops for 5 minutes. The company will use a tool called ProHance to put this into effect in a gradual rollout.

Man who attacked Ariana Grande at Wicked Singapore premiere gets 9 days in jailThe intruder who attempted to grab Ariana Grande at the Singapore premiere of 'Wicked: For Good' has been sentenced to nine days in prison. The film will release on November 21.

MDMA parcel, 187 transactions: How woman lost Rs 32 crore in 6-month digital arrestA 57-year-old Bengaluru woman was defrauded of Rs 31.83 crore after cybercriminals posing as courier service staff and CBI officers digitally "arrested" her for six months, forcing her to stay on Skype and make 187 bank transfers under threats of prosecution and surveillance.

Sholay's original ending: The climax India never saw, and reason it was scrappedAs 'Sholay' returns to theatres in a restored 4K version, audiences will finally see the film's original ending that never saw the light of the day. Here's what was in the climax and why it was scrapped.

Prashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj isn't dead, it's born really now. Here's whyPrashant Kishor's Jan Suraaj has drawn a blank in the Bihar Assembly polls, but those writing its political obituary should stop right away. The debutant's 3.4% vote share, which is more than that of the Left parties and the AIMIM combined, is a significant indicator of the traction it has. Though it lost deposits in most seats, it also has third-place finishes in over 54%of the seats contested.

Priyanka Chopra takes fans behind the scenes of Mahesh Babu's Varanasi eventPriyanka Chopra shared exclusive behind-the-scenes glimpses of the grand 'Varanasi' event at Hyderabad. The celebration featured a dramatic title reveal of SSMB29, with performances and heartfelt moments that captivated the audience.

Man who attacked Ariana Grande at Wicked Singapore premiere gets 9 days in jailThe intruder who attempted to grab Ariana Grande at the Singapore premiere of 'Wicked: For Good' has been sentenced to nine days in prison. The film will release on November 21.

sports.headline: FC Barcelona return to home stadium Spotify Camp Nou: First match decided Barcelona will finally return to the renovated Spotify Camp Nou after more than two seasons away. Their La Liga clash against Athletic Bilbao marks the first match at the revamped stadium since 2023.

Gavaskar on Eden Pitch Row: Blame India's Batting, Not the Wicket for South Africa Test Defeat. On this special report, Indian cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar weighs in on the controversy surrounding the Eden Gardens pitch after India's Test match loss to South Africa. Gavaskar defends the wicket, aligning with Indian Head Coach Gautam Gambhir, and argues that the focus should be on the Indian team's batting performance rather than the pitch conditions, highlighting South African captain Temba Bavuma's resilient innings as an example to follow. When asked about the pitch, Gavaskar stated, 'I don't think it was a pitch where you get all out for 90 runs like the Indian team did.' He firmly places the responsibility on the batters' temperament and technique, suggesting they failed to apply themselves correctly during the chase.

Am I Harmanpreet Kaur? Bangladesh captain launches brutal attack on India skipper Bangladesh captain Nigar Sultana Joty dismissed allegations of assaulting junior players and took a veiled dig at Harmanpreet Kaur while defending herself. In 2023, Harmanpreet was involved in a controversy during the Bangladesh tour.

Sri Lanka's Asalanka and Fernando return before Pakistan tri-series: Cite illness Sri Lanka captain Charith Asalanka and Asitha Fernando are returning home from Pakistan due to illness. Sri Lanka Cricket clarified the exits are unrelated to security concerns following the recent Islamabad blast.

Leave the curator alone: Sunil Gavaskar's clear verdict on Eden Gardens pitch row IND vs SA: Former India captain, Sunil Gavaskar believes teams should never interfere with a curator's work after India's Eden Test defeat. He says pitch manipulation can backfire and urges trust in the curator's expertise.

India's Spin Gambit Backfires; Gambhir's Test Coaching Under Fire After Proteas Loss This special report analyses India's 30-run Test match defeat to South Africa at Eden Gardens, a loss that has put coach Gautam Gambhir's red-ball record under scrutiny. The programme delves into the controversy surrounding the spin-friendly pitch, which the Indian team management reportedly requested, and features sharp analysis from former captains Sunil Gavaskar and Sourav Ganguly on the team's batting collapse and overall strategy. Sunil Gavaskar stated, 'It is just poor technique and poor temperament, which has got us into this situation.'

Watch: India, Pakistan players shake hands in Women's T20 World Cup for the Blind India and Pakistan players shared a rare handshake after their T20 World Cup for the Blind clash in Sri Lanka, breaking the no-handshake trend that had followed recent encounters between the two sides.

WPL 2026 set to be held in Mumbai, Baroda from January 7: Reports The WPL 2026 season is expected to be split between Mumbai and Baroda from January 7 to February 3, with DY Patil Stadium likely to host the opener and Kotambi Stadium set for the final. The auction will take place on November 27.

India should have chased 124 in Eden Gardens Test vs South Africa: Sunil Gavaskar India legend Sunil Gavaskar believes the hosts should have comfortably chased 124 in the Eden Gardens Test. He said the loss highlighted batting lapses rather than pitch conditions or external factors.

Sourav Ganguly Advises Team India to Play on Good Pitches and Win Tests in 5 Days This special report delves into the intense debate over India's Test cricket pitch strategy, featuring analysis from former India captain Sourav Ganguly and cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar. The discussion addresses whether India should prepare turning tracks from day one or opt for good batting pitches that last longer, following a recent loss on a spin-friendly wicket. Sourav Ganguly, the current President of the Cricket Association of Bengal, offered his advice, stating the team should 'win test matches in 5 days, not in 3 days'. The programme explores the differing philosophies, with Gavaskar suggesting curators should be left alone to prepare balanced surfaces, while Ganguly advocates for playing on good pitches against all opponents to build a resilient team.

Gavaskar backs Gambhir: Pitch fine. India batters lacked technique, temperament India vs South Africa: Sunil Gavaskar backed Gautam Gambhir's defence of the Eden Gardens pitch after India's 30-run loss in the first Test. His stance came even as former cricketers, including Cheteshwar Pujara and Harbhajan Singh, labelled the surface far from ideal for Test cricket.

Watch: India, Pakistan players shake hands in Women's T20 World Cup for the Blind India and Pakistan players shared a rare handshake after their T20 World Cup for the Blind clash in Sri Lanka, breaking the no-handshake trend that had followed recent encounters between the two sides.

WPL 2026 set to be held in Mumbai, Baroda from January 7: Reports The WPL 2026 season is expected to be split between Mumbai and Baroda from January 7 to February 3, with DY Patil Stadium likely to host the opener and Kotambi Stadium set for the final. The auction will take place on November 27.

India should have chased 124 in Eden Gardens Test vs South Africa: Sunil Gavaskar India legend Sunil Gavaskar believes the hosts should have comfortably chased 124 in the Eden Gardens Test. He said the loss highlighted batting lapses rather than pitch conditions or external factors.

Sourav Ganguly Advises Team India to Play on Good Pitches and Win Tests in 5 Days This special report delves into the intense debate over India's Test cricket pitch strategy, featuring analysis from former India captain Sourav Ganguly and cricket legend Sunil Gavaskar. The discussion addresses whether India should prepare turning tracks from day one or opt for good batting pitches that last longer, following a recent loss on a spin-friendly wicket. Sourav Ganguly, the current President of the Cricket Association of Bengal, offered his advice, stating the team should 'win test matches in 5 days, not in 3 days'. The programme explores the differing philosophies, with Gavaskar suggesting curators should be left alone to prepare balanced surfaces, while Ganguly advocates for playing on good pitches against all opponents to build a resilient team.

Gavaskar backs Gambhir: Pitch fine. India batters lacked technique, temperament India vs South Africa: Sunil Gavaskar backed Gautam Gambhir's defence of the Eden Gardens pitch after India's 30-run loss in the first Test. His stance came even as former cricketers, including Cheteshwar Pujara and Harbhajan Singh, labelled the surface far from ideal for Test cricket.

Eden curator responds to criticism of pitch after India's shock lossIND vs SA: Eden Gardens curator Sujan Mukherjee defended the much-criticised pitch after India's two-day defeat to South Africa, saying he simply followed instructions and stood by his preparation.

Former India player calls out Rishabh Pant's captaincy in Eden Test loss: Needed GillMohammad Kaif highlighted Rishabh Pant's on-field decisions as a key factor in India's Eden Test defeat. Shubman Gill's injury absence and another batting collapse added to India's problems in the loss to South Africa.

Who is Laila Hasanovic? Jannik Sinner celebrates ATP Finals win with girlfriendJannik Sinner celebrated his ATP Finals triumph by sharing a warm moment with girlfriend Laila Hasanovic after defeating Carlos Alcaraz in straight sets. Despite the win, Alcaraz still finished as year-end World No. 1.

Ashes: Big boost for Australia as fit-again Pat Cummins bowls full tilt in PerthPat Cummins returned to full-intensity bowling, giving Australia a boost ahead of the Ashes, even though he remained ruled out of the first Test. In his absence, Brendan Doggett is set for a historic debut.

Shubman Gill to travel to Guwahati, though 2nd Test participation remains in doubtIndia captain Shubman Gill has been discharged from hospital after a neck injury. His participation in the second Test remains uncertain, but he will travel with the team to Guwahati.

Fear under Gautam Gambhir: Ex-player makes big claim after Kolkata Test shockerIndia vs South Africa: Former batter Mohammad Kaif said batters in the current Test team are playing with fear for their places and a lot of insecurity. He alleged that the Gautam Gambhir-led team management has not been backing the batters enough.

India should not have all-format captain, split captaincy is smart move: MukundFormer India opener Abhinav Mukund believes India should not have an all-format captain and that split captaincy is the right move for Indian cricket.

East Bengal begin AFC Women's Champions League with strong 3–1 win vs Bam Khatoon FCEast Bengal opened their AFC Women's Champions League campaign with a solid 3–1 win over Bam Khatoon FC. The result gives them an early boost ahead of their next clash against defending champions Wuhan Jiangda.

Shubman Gill to travel to Guwahati, though 2nd Test participation remains in doubtIndia captain Shubman Gill has been discharged from hospital after a neck injury. His participation in the second Test remains uncertain, but he will travel with the team to Guwahati.

Fear under Gautam Gambhir: Ex-player makes big claim after Kolkata Test shockerIndia vs South Africa: Former batter Mohammad Kaif said batters in the current Test team are playing with fear for their places and a lot of insecurity. He alleged that the Gautam Gambhir-led team management has not been backing the batters enough.

India should not have all-format captain, split captaincy is smart move: MukundFormer India opener Abhinav Mukund believes India should not have an all-format captain and that split captaincy is the right move for Indian cricket.

East Bengal begin AFC Women's Champions League with strong 3–1 win vs Bam Khatoon FCEast Bengal opened their AFC Women's Champions League campaign with a solid 3–1 win over Bam Khatoon FC. The result gives them an early boost ahead of their next clash against defending champions Wuhan Jiangda.

Who is Brendan Doggett? The Indigenous man set for Australia Test debut in AshesBrendan Doggett is set to become Australia's 472nd Test cricketer and only the third Indigenous man to play Test cricket for the country, marking a historic moment as he closes in on his Ashes debut.

Alcaraz and Sinner now tied at 1,651 points each after Nitto ATP Finals showdownJannik Sinner's ATP Finals win over Carlos Alcaraz confirmed a rare statistical deadlock in their rivalry. Both players have now won exactly 1,651 of the 3,302 points played between them.

Joe Root most prized wicket: Boland downplays star's poor record in AustraliaAshes: Australia's Scott Boland said Joe Root remains the most sought-after wicket in the England batting order, even though the former English captain is still waiting for his first Ashes hundred in Australia.

Watch: Karma hits Dominik Szoboszlai hard as Hungary knocked out by IrelandDominik Szoboszlai's mocking celebration backfired as Ireland stunned Hungary to secure a spot in the play-offs for the World Cup qualifiers. The loss against the Irish side meant that Hungary were knocked out in the group stages.

Fear behind the turn: How Gautam Gambhir's pitch policy amplifies India's weaknessIndia's historic home Test dominance is unravelling. A steep batting slump against spin and risky pitch tactics under Gautam Gambhir have exposed vulnerabilities, culminating in crushing defeats like the 2024 New Zealand series. Yet, the coach refuses to learn from mistakes.

IPL tougher than internationals? KL Rahul says captains are always questionedOpening up about the pressures of IPL leadership, KL Rahul said the demands of franchise cricket can be more draining than international duties, pointing to ownership-level scrutiny, relentless expectations and rapid team changes as major challenges modern players must navigate.

PCB chief Mohsin Naqvi overjoyed as Pakistan stun India in Rising Stars Asia CupMohsin Naqvi was thrilled with Pakistan Shaheens' comprehensive win over India in the Rising Stars Asia Cup 2025. The PCB chairman hailed the win and praised the performance from the team.

Pakistan board hands Sarfaraz Ahmed full responsibility of Shaheens, U19 setupThe Pakistan Cricket Board has handed former captain Sarfaraz Ahmed full responsibility for overseeing the Pakistan Shaheens and Under-19 teams, marking a significant restructuring step as the board looks to strengthen its pathway programmes.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
